meanings.definition: Injury to the skin caused by exposure to wind.
meanings.sent1: After skiing all day, I got a painful windburn on my face.
meanings.sent2: She applied lotion to soothe the windburn on her cheeks.
meanings.sent3: The windburn on his nose made him look like a tomato.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter wind was like a painter, leaving a red windburn on the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The windburn felt like tiny needles pricking my skin.

meanings.definition: To cause windburn to someone's skin.
meanings.sent1: The strong gusts can easily windburn your face if you're not careful.
meanings.sent2: Be sure to wear a scarf to prevent windburning your neck.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to windburn his friend with a leaf blower.
meanings.sent4: Her words were sharp enough to windburn his ego.
meanings.sent5: The intense sun combined with the wind can quickly windburn exposed skin.
